title: Legislative Day 36 - 2023 Session - 03/20/23
summary:
Overview: The Georgia legislative session on March 20, 2023 featured the introduction of several new bills and resolutions, as well as the recommittal of SR334 to the Rules Committee. Notable legislation included bills related to city charters, tax exemptions, and school systems.

Key Actions:
**HR 334**: Resolution changing the rules of the Senate, recommitted to the Rules Committee
**HB 373, HB493, HB545, SB 140**: Bills not explicitly mentioned in the transcript

Bills Introduced (First Reading):
- SB 309: Homestead exemption for City of Hampton ad valorem taxes
- SB 310: New charter for City of Powder Springs
- SR 347: Honoring life of Mr. Sean P. Kornakian
- SR 352: Committing Atlanta Public Schools on 150th anniversary
- HB 597, HB 666, HB 695, HB 702, HB 703, HB 708, HB 709: Various city charter and school system bills

Notable Moments:
- Senator from the 28th moved to recommit SR334 to the Rules Committee
- President recognized senators and pages for their service

Votes:
- SR334 recommitted to Rules Committee (objection raised, motion passed)

Attendance:
- Quorum present, no issues noted

Adjournment:
- Transcript does not indicate when the session adjourned or the date of the next session.
